summary: The EQIP Improvement Act of 2025 amends the Food Security Act of 1985 to adjust the Environmental Quality Incentives Program (EQIP). It modifies payment limitations for producers, specifying different cost-sharing percentages based on the type of practice. The bill also changes the allocation of funding for wildlife habitat and lowers the payment limitation in section 1240G. Furthermore, it mandates an annual report to Congress detailing program obligations by practice category, fiscal year, State, and producer operation size.
